action.action-desc: Mr. Good of Virginia (for himself, Mr. Weber of Texas, Mr. DesJarlais, Mr. Norman, Mr. Mike Garcia of California, Mr. Carl, Mr. Donalds, Mr. Tiffany, Mrs. Miller of Illinois, Mr. Higgins of Louisiana, Mr. Wilson of South Carolina, Mr. Moolenaar, Mr. Pfluger, and Ms. Tenney) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to provide for the elimination of delimiting dates under the educational assistance programs of the Department of Veterans Affairs, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Veterans Education is Timeless Act of 2023.

section.header: Elimination of delimiting dates under Department of Veterans Affairs educational assistance programs

subsection.header: All volunteer force educational assistance program

paragraph.text: Section 3031 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to read as follows:

section.header: No time limitation for use of eligibility and entitlement
section.text: Educational assistance benefits shall be afforded an eligible veteran under this chapter at any time and are not subject to any delimiting date.

paragraph.text: The table of sections at the beginning of chapter 30 of such title is amended by striking the item relating to section 3031 and inserting the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: 3031. No time limitation for use of eligibility and entitlement.

subsection.text: Section 3232 of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by inserting the following new subsections (a) and (b):

subsection.text: Educational assistance benefits shall be afforded an eligible veteran under this chapter at any time and are not subject to any delimiting date.
The Secretary shall refund to a veteran any contributions made by the veteran if the veteran applies for such refund.

paragraph.text: Section 3321 of such title is amended to read as follows:

section.header: No time limitation for use of eligibility and entitlement
section.text: Educational assistance benefits shall be afforded an eligible person under this chapter at any time and are not subject to any delimiting date.

paragraph.text: The table of sections at the beginning of chapter 33 of such title is amended by striking the item relating to section 3321 and inserting the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: 3321. No time limitation for use of eligibility and entitlement.

subsection.text: Paragraph (2) of subsection (f) of section 3311 of such title is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: The entitlement of an individual to assistance under subsection (a) pursuant to paragraphs (8), (9), and (10) of subsection (b) shall not expire and shall not be subject to any delimiting date.

subsection.header: Survivors’ and dependents’ educational assistance program

paragraph.text: Section 3512 of such title is amended to read as follows:

section.header: No time limitation for use of eligibility and entitlement
section.text: Educational assistance benefits shall be afforded an eligible person under this chapter at any time and are not subject to any delimiting date.

paragraph.text: The table of sections at the beginning of chapter 35 of such title is amended by striking the item relating to section 3512 and inserting the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: 3512. No time limitation for use of eligibility and entitlement.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act and shall apply with respect to any person who is or was entitled to educational assistance before, on, or after the date of the enactment of this Act.
